title: Ukraine opens probe into Russia’s alleged killing of four prisoners of war
snippets: The Associated Press news agency has verified footage from Ukrainian and Russian sources depicting the four soldiers.
summary: The Associated Press has confirmed the authenticity of footage showing four soldiers, with verification coming from both Ukrainian and Russian sources. This validation ensures the credibility of the content depicting the soldiers, highlighting the agency's commitment to factual reporting.
titles: Ukraine opens probe into Russia’s alleged killing of four prisoners of war

title: Taiwan charges captain of China-linked ship with damaging subsea cable
snippets: The case marks a first for Taiwan in prosecuting what it alleged is deliberate damage to a subsea cable.
summary: Taiwan has initiated its first prosecution for alleged deliberate damage to a subsea cable. This landmark case underscores the island's efforts to protect its critical infrastructure.
titles: Taiwan charges captain of China-linked ship with damaging subsea cable

title: UK announces further £450m military support to Ukraine
snippets: The package includes funding for radar systems, anti-tank mines and hundreds of thousands of drones.
summary: A funding package has been approved to enhance military capabilities, including the purchase of radar systems and anti-tank mines. Additionally, the package will fund the acquisition of hundreds of thousands of drones, significantly expanding aerial surveillance and operational capacities.
titles: UK announces further £450m military support to Ukraine

title: Watch: 'The helicopter just fell' - Hudson River crash leaves six dead
snippets: New York City Mayor Eric Adams confirmed all six people on board the flight were visiting from Spain.
summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams confirmed that all six individuals on a flight were visitors from Spain. This statement provides clarity on the nationalities of the passengers involved in the incident.
titles: Watch: 'The helicopter just fell' - Hudson River crash leaves six dead

title: China to ‘reduce’ Hollywood movie releases in response to Trump’s tariffs
snippets: China's National Film Administration says US movies will be less popular after Washington imposed a 145 percent tariff.
summary: China's National Film Administration has stated that US movies are expected to decrease in popularity in China following the imposition of a 145 percent tariff by Washington. This move is anticipated to impact the distribution and viewership of American films within the Chinese market.
titles: China to ‘reduce’ Hollywood movie releases in response to Trump’s tariffs

summary: A soccer match was halted in the 70th minute because of disruptive behavior from spectators. The decision to suspend the game was made to ensure the safety of all participants and attendees. The current status of the match and any decisions regarding rescheduling or outcomes due to the suspension have not been provided.
titles: Two fans killed at Copa Libertadores football match in Chile after ‘stampede’

titles: Capitals celebrate Ovi's record, wrap up top seed

The extension of his stay is significant for the team, indicating his ongoing support and ambition for future achievements with Liverpool.
titles: “I Believe We Can Win Many Trophies” – Mohamed Salah Explains Why he Has Signed a New Liverpool Contract

title: How leaky Rangers shut up shop against Athletic Bilbao
snippets: Rangers survived sweeping changes, dropping their number one goalkeeper, suffering an early red card and conceding a late penalty to hold Athletic Bilbao. How did they do it?
summary: Rangers managed to secure a draw against Athletic Bilbao despite significant challenges. They played without their first-choice goalkeeper, faced an early red card in the game, and conceded a late penalty. Despite these setbacks, Rangers successfully held Athletic Bilbao to a draw.
titles: How leaky Rangers shut up shop against Athletic Bilbao

title: If Bills chose to wait to pick a CB in draft, these four may make it to Day 2

title: Dollar and Treasuries sell off as Trump’s China tariffs spook investors
snippets: Scale of US levies on Chinese goods deepens recession fears
summary: The US has imposed significant tariffs on Chinese goods, intensifying concerns about a potential recession. These levies are part of ongoing economic tensions between the two countries and have raised worries about their impact on global economic stability.
titles: Dollar and Treasuries sell off as Trump’s China tariffs spook investors

title: Gold Hits Record High and Miner Stocks Surge Amid Tariff Uncertainty
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The price of gold hit an all-time high Thursday as investors sought safe haven assets amid tariff-fueled volatility.
  • Shares of gold mining companies also surged, with Newmont's gains making it best-performing stock in the S&P 500 Thursday.
  • The rally for gold and miner stocks came as broader markets declined, giving back a significant chunk of Wednesday's historic gains.


The price of gold hit an all-time high Thursday, with shares of Newmont (NEM) and other miners surging along with it as investors sought safe haven assets amid tariff-fueled volatility. 

The price of gold was up nearly 4% Thursday afternoon to a record $3,193.80 per ounce. Meanwhile, Newmont shares rose close to 5%, making it best-performing stock in the S&P 500 Thursday. Barrick Gold (GOLD) shares added nearly 4%, while Kinross Gold (KGC) climbed 5%, and Gold Fields (GFI) jumped over 8% to close at an all-time high.

Long viewed as a safe haven asset, investors have flocked to gold amid worries about tariffs and economic uncertainty. Thursday's rally for gold and miner stocks came as broader markets declined, giving back a significant chunk of Wednesday's historic gains. (Read Investopedia's live coverage of today's market action here.)
summary: The spot price of gold reached a record high of $3,193.80 per ounce on Thursday, driven by investor demand for safe haven assets amid tariff-induced market volatility. This surge also led to significant gains for gold mining companies, with Newmont's stock rising close to 5%, making it the best-performing stock in the S&P 500 for the day. Other miners like Barrick Gold, Kinross Gold, and Gold Fields also saw their shares increase, with Gold Fields' shares hitting an all-time high. The rally in gold and miner stocks occurred as the broader markets fell, reversing some of the previous day's gain
titles: Gold Hits Record High and Miner Stocks Surge Amid Tariff Uncertainty

title: Trump tests the American attitude to pain
snippets: It’s not just bread and circuses any more
summary: The phrase "bread and circuses," historically used to describe efforts by governments to appease public discontent through diversion and basic needs, is no longer seen as an adequate description of contemporary societal dynamics. The implication is that current strategies to maintain public satisfaction or distract from issues have evolved beyond just providing essentials and entertainment.
titles: Trump tests the American attitude to pain

title: Renault emerges as winner in Trump tariff chaos
snippets: Insulated from industry tumult, smaller French group seeks to move on from turnaround by boosting EV and hybrid sales
summary: A small French automotive group, having successfully navigated industry challenges, is now focusing on expanding its electric vehicle (EV) and hybrid sales. This shift comes after the company completed a turnaround phase, positioning itself for future growth in the evolving auto market.
titles: Renault emerges as winner in Trump tariff chaos

title: Swiss drugmaker Novartis to invest $23bn in US manufacturing and R&D
snippets: Pharma group builds out American supply chains as part of preparations for potential US tariffs
summary: A pharmaceutical group is expanding its supply chains within the United States in anticipation of possible tariffs. This move aims to mitigate the impact of potential trade restrictions and ensure a stable supply of pharmaceutical products in the U.S. market.
titles: Swiss drugmaker Novartis to invest $23bn in US manufacturing and R&D

title: Denisovan fossil from Taiwan gives clue to mysterious ancient humans
snippets: A fossil jawbone found by fishers in the Taiwan Strait has extended the known range of ancient Denisovan people thousands of kilometres to the east
summary: A fossil jawbone discovered by fishers in the Taiwan Strait has significantly expanded the geographical range of the ancient Denisovan people. This finding indicates that Denisovans lived thousands of kilometres further east than previously documented.
titles: Denisovan fossil from Taiwan gives clue to mysterious ancient humans

title: The evolution of easier births means slower walking and pelvis issues
snippets: Wider hips may make childbirth easier, but increase the risk of other health issues
summary: Research indicates that while wider hips can facilitate easier childbirth by providing more space for a baby to be born, this physical trait is also associated with an increased risk of developing certain health problems. The specific health issues linked to wider hips were not detailed in the provided content.
titles: The evolution of easier births means slower walking and pelvis issues

title: Where Schrödinger’s cat came from – and why it’s getting fatter
snippets: Schrödinger called his metaphorical cat “quite ridiculous” but the quantum weirdness it represents has become a useful benchmark for the quantum computing industry, finds our quantum columnist Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
summary: Schrödinger's metaphorical cat, originally described as "quite ridiculous" by its creator, has evolved into a significant benchmark within the quantum computing industry, according to quantum columnist Karmela Padavic-Callaghan. This reflects the industry's embrace of quantum weirdness as a foundational concept.
titles: Where Schrödinger’s cat came from – and why it’s getting fatter

title: Should we give up on recycling plastic?
snippets: Globally, only 14 per cent of the plastic we use is recycled – but some countries achieve higher rates and new technologies could change the picture drastically
summary: Globally, 14% of plastic is recycled, with some countries exceeding this average. Advances in recycling technology may significantly improve these rates.
titles: Should we give up on recycling plastic?

title: AI-powered chilli spray could deter bears without injuring them
snippets: A machine controlled by AI that sprays bears with the chilli pepper chemical capsaicin could reduce dangerous confrontations with people
summary: An AI-controlled machine that emits capsaicin, the spicy compound found in chili peppers, has been developed to deter bears, aiming to minimize risky encounters between bears and humans.
titles: AI-powered chilli spray could deter bears without injuring them
